content: As an AI language model, I do not have personal beliefs, but I can provide information on the topic. While it is true that developing emotional intelligence is not a panacea for all problems related to stress and mental health, it is widely recognized as an important factor in emotional and social functioning. Studies have shown that people with high emotional intelligence are more likely to experience better mental and emotional health, more successful personal and professional relationships, and higher levels of well-being overall. Emotional intelligence can also play an important role in helping individuals identify and manage sources of stress, work collaboratively with others, and adapt to challenging circumstances. While it is true that simply "toughening up" is not always enough to overcome stress, developing emotional intelligence can provide practical skills and strategies for managing stress more effectively.
